results.title: Central Australia: tracks in the sand
results.creator_credit: John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Australian wilderness series”.
Cartoonist Michael Leunig records his impressions of Alice Springs, Ayers Rock and the vast emptiness of the Simpson Desert. Viewers are privy to a special meeting of minds and cultures, when he shares a canvas on the sand with Aboriginal artist, Michael Nelson. Accompanied by a Teacher’s guide.

results.title: Living in Two Worlds
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Face Australia”.
Looks at a suburban industrial “ghetto” in Wollongong which is made up almost entirely of migrants.

results.title: More tricks than we have (TEFC)
results.brief_description: An introduction to how theatre in education works. Begins with a group of actors from Toe Truck Theatre and their director in the early stages of devising a play. We see the performance and follow up discussions and workshops. Based on the play “Year 9 are animals”, which tells the story of an enthusiastic first year teacher and the problems he encounters.

results.title: Robert Boynes
results.creator_credit: Ken Otton, Robert Lindsay, Lloyd Carrick and Alan Cole
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
Robert Boynes is often grouped with a number of Australian artists who, working from the mid 1960’s, are referred to as “Australian Pop” artists. Australian pop has its own distinct flavour, different from the U.S. and U.K. schools, and related to the Australian environment
